Topic: Draw a string telephone between two students.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two people who want to communicate over a long distance.
The student can draw a string telephone device that connects the two people.
The student can show in the drawing that the string telephone uses sound to send and receive information.
The student can include symbols or notes in the drawing that explain how sound travels through the string.
The student can highlight how the device helps people communicate, such as by showing happy faces or conversation bubbles.
The student can use labels to show the important parts of the drawing, such as the cups and string.
The student can use the materials provided for their drawing to show how the solution works.
